author: casparschwa
content: I have briefly thought about this too. If one rewards retroactively one can also try to incentivize timeliness of proposer duties (i.e. propose 0s as opposed to close to 4s into slot). A heuristic could be to scale the proposer's reward by the share of same-slot committee votes that a block receives and are included in the subsequent block. Idea being that the earlier a block is proposed the more likely it is to receive many same-slot votes. Obvious caveat being that MEV incentives may dominate.
